definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: In my frame of mind, I'd like to buy one today.
sentences.chinese: 按我現在的心氣，我就想買下了。

sentences.english: Can you a standing ovation a third camp?Just was trained by me, the heart spirit was tall.
sentences.chinese: 你能管住第三營麼？剛被我訓練過，心氣可高。

sentences.english: The heart-qi is the fundamental motive power to propel blood circulation.
sentences.chinese: 心氣是推動血液循行的原動力。

sentences.english: It will drain you and rob you of your happiness.
sentences.chinese: 它將耗盡你的心氣，奪走你的快樂。

sentences.english: A woman must needs follow her own fancy touching the adornment of her person.
sentences.chinese: 觸及女人的裝飾一事，那可得隨着她自己的心氣兒。

sentences.english: In my of mind, I'd like to buy one today .
sentences.chinese: 按我現在的心氣，我今天就想買下了。

sentences.english: Thereby the condition of heart-qi and the blood volume may be shown in both the pulse condition and the complexion.
sentences.chinese: 因此，心氣的狀況和血液量可以從脈象和麪色中體現。

sentences.english: With great ambitions, a man can achieve great things; without, one can achieve nothing.
sentences.chinese: 心氣高遠纔能有所成就，否則只能一事無成。

definition: to suffer from pent-up frustrations/mental knot/emotional issue
to think sth through/to consider carefully
to stagnate/to congeal/(fig.) to stop still/to freeze
to get it straight/to start to understand things properly/enlightenment dawns
evil influence/unhealthy trend/(a person's) evil air/aura of wickedness/(TCM) pathogenic energy (opposite: 正氣|正气[zheng4 qi4], vital energy)
healthy environment/healthy atmosphere/righteousness/vital energy (in Chinese medicine)
to take a tonic or nourishing food to build up one's health
treatment involving the use of tonics to restore the patient's health/reinforcing method (in acupuncture)
medicinal dietary supplement that helps build up one's health
